level.heading: Authority to debar or suspend.
level.text: Repealed.

level.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 3(e) of the Procurement Reform Temporary Amendment Act of 1997 (D.C. Law 12-17, September 12, 1997, law notification 44 DCR 5459)
For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of the Debarment Procedures Temporary Amendment Act of 2003 (D.C. Law 15-71, February 6, 2004, law notification 51 DCR 2038).
For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of the Debarment Procedures Temporary Amendment Act of 2004 (D.C. Law 15-246, March 17, 2005, law notification 52 DCR 4122).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary amendment of section, see § 3(e) of the Procurement Reform Emergency Amendment Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-62, April 15, 1997, 44 DCR 2413).
For temporary amendment of section, see § 3(e) of the Procurement Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-133, August 12, 1997, 44 DCR 4832).
For temporary amendment of section, see § 2(e) of the Procurement Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-374, April 24, 1998, 45 DCR 4338).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of Debarment Procedures Emergency Amendment Act of 2003 (D.C. Act 15-153, September 30, 2003, 50 DCR 8730).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of Debarment Procedures Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2004 (D.C. Act 15-349, February 6, 2004, 51 DCR 1840).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of Debarment Procedures Emergency Amendment Act of 2004 (D.C. Act 15-550, October 27, 2004, 51 DCR 10345).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of Debarment Procedures Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2005 (D.C. Act 16-4, January 19, 2005, 52 DCR 2679).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 6-85
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-85, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-301.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-258
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-258, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-301.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-259
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-259, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-301.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-81
level.text: Law 12-81, the "Technical Amendments Act of 1998," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-408, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 4, 1997, and December 4, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 22, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-246 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-81 became effective on March 24, 1998.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-104
level.text: Law 12-104, the "Procurement Reform Amendment Act of 1998," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-363, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 1997, and January 6, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 3, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-280 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-104 became effective on May 8, 1998.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-264
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-264, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-301.05.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-91
level.text: For Law 13-91, see notes following § 2-201.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 15-327
level.text: Law 15-327, the "Debarment Procedures Amendment Act of 2004", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 15-833, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 9, 2004, and December 7, 2004, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 29, 2004, it was assigned Act No. 15-683 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 15-327 became effective on April 12, 2005.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 16-91
level.text: For Law 16-91, see notes following § 2-218.54.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 16-191
level.text: For Law 16-191, see notes following § 2-218.02.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 17-353
level.text: For Law 17-353, see notes following § 2-218.42.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-62
level.text: Law 18-62, the "Debarment and Suspension Procedures Amendment Act of 2009", as introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-2, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 30, 2009, and July 14, 2009, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 28, 2009, it was assigned Act No. 18-158 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-62 became effective on October 22, 2009.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-141
level.text: For Law 18-141, see notes following § 2-218.02.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-371
level.text: For history of Law 18-371, see notes under § 2-301.01.
